result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Denise A Cloute was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences Ms. Cloute to 12 months in Jail with Huber privileges consecutive to any other sentence. The Court does not allow the use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term. The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years.
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

--Victim impact panel attendance

--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months

--6 demerit points assessed

miscConds.notes: Separate from the Conditions of Probation, the Court orders the Defendant to pay a fine of $1,000  + costs and surcharges, along with $56.74 in blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office [clerk's calculation of the total:  $2,379.74]  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term consecutive, with Huber privileges.

--to maintain absolute sobriety

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 

--to take all prescriptions as prescribed

--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and Agent approval

--to comply with all conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court

--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--To serve 60 days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release privileges; to commence forthwith, followed immediately by 30 days on Scram Cam (as approved by the Memorandum of Understanding signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff). "Good time" credit is to be applied to both components of order.  Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.  The Defendant is allowed one 24-hour furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday [under the furlough terms as set forth on the Criminal Case Settlement form]. This 24-hour period will not count as time spend serving the jail term, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later than it otherwise would have. 

--to submit a DNA sample

--300 days conditional jail time is imposed and stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the Treatment Court judge or his/her designee for sanctions. If the Defendant completes the Treatment Court program, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However if the Defendant is removed from the Treatment Court program, this conditional jail time shall be served.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
[MK] Upon review of her minutes from the 10/6/22 Plea & Sentencing hearing, the clerk realizes that she was not accurate in setting forth the Court's Order regarding payment of the court financial obligations. The Court did not order payment of the $1,000 fine plus costs and blood testing fees as a condition of Probation.   Instead the Court ordered as follows: 

Separate from the Conditions of Probation, the Court orders the Defendant to pay a fine of $1,000  + costs and surcharges, along with $56.74 in blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office [clerk's calculation of the total:  $2,379.74]  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term consecutive, with Huber privileges.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:04am 
Defendant Denise A Cloute in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses outright Count #2.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Ms. Cloute to 12 months in Jail with Huber privileges consecutive to any other sentence. The Court does not allow the use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term. 
Days credit for time served: 3  days. 

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

 --To serve 60 days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release privileges; to commence forthwith, followed immediately by 30 days on Scram Cam (as approved by the Memorandum of Understanding signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff). "Good time" credit is to be applied to both components of order.  Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.  The Defendant is allowed one 24-hour furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday [under the furlough terms as set forth on the Criminal Case Settlement form]. This 24-hour period will not count as time spend serving the jail term, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later than it otherwise would have. 
--to comply with all conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and Agent approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit a DNA sample
--300 days conditional jail time is imposed and stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the Treatment Court judge or his/her designee for sanctions. If the Defendant completes the Treatment Court program, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However if the Defendant is removed from the Treatment Court program, this conditional jail time shall be served.
--To pay a  fine of $1,000 plus costs, along with $56.74 in blood testing costs incurred by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office. 

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Judgment of Conviction to indicate: "ALCOHOL TREATMENT COURT PARTICIPANT" 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 10:26pm

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:37am 
Defendant Denise A Cloute in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Ms. Cloute waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Conditions of this Bond include:
-  No alcohol consumption.
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:20PM
Defendant Denise A Cloute appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify).  ADA Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel agree that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given; the Defendant advises that she would be interested in applying for court appointed counsel.
The Court preserves the Defendant's jurisdictional and constitutional objections and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
-  No alcohol consumption.
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:27
